eligibility:
PO1:
Demonstrate awareness of core biology subjects like Cytology, Biochemistry, Microbiology, Analytical Techniques, Biostatistics and the implications of these topics in the botanical studies
PO2:
Appreciate the in-depth knowledge on advanced basic botany courses like Spermatophytes, Cryptogams etc
PO3:
Introduction of applied botany modules on Taxonomy, Plant Tissue Culture, Phytochemistry, Plant Pathology etc
PO4:
Demonstrate skills in undertaking research in Universities and R&D Centres
PO5:
Attempt competitive exams like CSIR NET, SET etc
why_choose: Why choose this course? Critical thinking Analytical skills self-directed and long-term learning scientific communication Application of knowledge Skills for socio-economic benefits
what_learn: What you will learn? In-depth theoretical and technical concepts in the discipline of plant science such as systematics, evolution, physiology, anatomy, genetics, reproduction, molecular biology, tissue culture techniques and interaction of plants with microbes and insects. Plan and execute scientific experiments for problem solving in research Understand and demonstrate human values and ethics in science to be a responsible citizen Able to explore the wide range of avenues in botany for a green and sustainable environment Explore industrial application of biotechnology for the production of therapeutics, crop improvement, biofuels for the welfare of the society Able to apply computational and analytical software tools for analyze and interpret biological data
modules: Modules Phycology, Mycology and Crop Mathematics for Biologists Research Methodology in Biological Sciences Semester 1 Biochemistry Pathology Microbiology Genetics Phycology, Mycology, Crop Pathology and Genetics Lab Data Analysis by using SPSS software Cell and Molecular Biology Bioanalytical Tools and Bioinformatics Semester 2 Archegoniate Biostatistics Genetic Engineering Plant Micro techniques and Plant Anatomy Plant Biotechnology and Regulatory Affairs Plant Physiology and metabolism Semester 3 Plant Breeding and Developmental Biology Angiosperm systematics and Taxonomy Summer Internship Electives Nutrition and Health Science Food Technology Biopharmaceutical QA Semester 4 Nanobiotechnology Food, Agricultural and Environmental Microbiology Forensic Biology Oceanography and Fishery technology Dissertation OR Industrial project
